# Draft:Debidwar Government Reaz Uddin Pilot Model High School

----
Debidwar Government Reaz Uddin Pilot Model High School is a government secondery school in Debidwer,Cumilla,Bangladesh. The institution was established in 1918.
History
Debidwer Government Reaz Uddin Pilot Model High School was established in 1 January, 1918, making it one of the oldest secondary schools in Comilla District. It was founded by Nobab Kazi Golam Mohiuddin Faruki (Son of ABM Golam Mutafa)
The school was founded to provide modern education to the people of Debidwer and surrounding areas during the British colonial period. Over the decades, it has played a significant role in the spread of education in the region.
In 1918, the school was nationalized and became a government institution.
The school has since expanded its facilities and student capacity, offering education from grade 6 to grade 10 under the Comilla Education Board.
The institution has celebrated several milestones, including its centenary in 2018.
Extracurricular activities
Debidwer Government Reaz Uddin Pilot Model High School offers a variety of extracurricular activities to support the overall development of its students.
The school has active units of the BNCC and Scout programs, where students participate in leadership, discipline, and community service activities.
Sports are an important part of student life. The school has teams for football, cricket, handball, and kabaddi, which regularly compete in inter-school tournaments. Every year, the school organizes an annual sports competition, bringing together students to showcase their talents and team spirit.
